overview:
Mark Bozek formed media company Galgos Entertainment in 2006 with partner, Russell Nuce.

Prior to forming Galgos, Bozek worked for 14 years with Barry Diller, initially as a producer at Fox Television, then as a Senior Vice President at QVC, and later as CEO of HSN, a division of IAC. During his tenure at HSN, Bozek led a team of over 6,000 employees and the company generated over $10 billion in sales and $2 billion in profits.

Bozek launched HSN.com in 1998 and grew the business to over $100 million in eighteen months and was responsible for the international launches of HSN in Japan, Europe and China. While at HSN, he purchased entrepreneur Joy Manganoâ€™s company, Ingenious Designs, and it grew to become one of HSNâ€™s top vendors with over $100 million in annual sales.

Bozek was at Fox Television near its inception in 1998, where he was a three-time Emmy nominee.

Prior to his role at Fox TV, Bozek was Vice President of Marketing for men and women”s apparel company WilliWear/Willi Smith where he was responsible for worldwide marketing and advertising.

He currently serves on the board of Sykes Enterprises, a publicly held company. He is also a board trustee of the Long Island Children’s Museum. He has also served on the Boards of the National Retail Federation and the Electronic Retailers Organization.
